message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SD, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SD. 

The paper focuses on developing a conversational speech recognition system using neural network-based acoustic and language modeling techniques. This falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP) and speech recognition, which is covered by cs.CL (Computation and Language) sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of machine learning ensemble techniques, which is covered by cs.SD (Sound) sub-category. Additionally, the paper uses i-vector modeling and lattice-free MMI training, which are techniques used in machine learning and deep learning, respectively, and are covered by cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category. The paper also discusses language model rescoring and word posterior-based system combination, which are techniques used in artificial intelligence and NLP, and are covered by cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the results of the system on the Switchboard recognition task, which is a benchmark task in speech recognition, and is covered by cs.SD sub-category.
